text:
HAOHSIANG LIAO: My
name is Haohsiang Liao.

I'm the senior lecturer
directing the Chinese Language
Program here at MIT.

And since I've been here, I've
been in charge of Chinese 101

to Chinese 104 and
that's basically

the beginning level to the
intermediate level of Chinese.

So my interest in
teaching languages

started when I was a
grad student in Taiwan.

That was this time
that Taiwan started

to establish its first grad
school of teaching Chinese

as a second language,
which was about 1994.

So I was a grad
student there and that

was the time I started
to develop my interest
in teaching foreigners Chinese.

So I was there for
three years and they

got me an opportunity to do an
internship at Williams College.

So I was at Williams for
one year and at Williams,

that was the eye-opening
experience for me

and that was really the moment
I decided to devote myself
into this profession.
